content: Isaiah Assures Deliverance(A)
And so it was, when King Hezekiah heard  that he tore his clothes, covered himself with sackcloth, and went into the house of the .
Then he sent Eliakim, who  over the household, Shebna the scribe, and the elders of the priests, covered with sackcloth, to Isaiah the prophet, the son of Amoz.
And they said to him, “Thus says Hezekiah: ‘This day  a day of trouble and rebuke and blasphemy; for the children have come to birth, but  no strength to bring them forth.

It may be that the  your God will hear the words of  Rabshakeh, whom his master the king of Assyria has sent to reproach the living God, and will rebuke the words which the  your God has heard. Therefore lift up  prayer for the remnant that is left.’ ”
So the servants of King Hezekiah came to Isaiah.
And Isaiah said to them, “Thus you shall say to your master, ‘Thus says the : “Do not be afraid of the words which you have heard, with which the servants of the king of Assyria have blasphemed Me.
Surely I will send a spirit upon him, and he shall hear a rumor and return to his own land; and I will cause him to fall by the sword in his own land.” ’ ”
Sennacherib’s Threat and Hezekiah’s Prayer(E)
Then  Rabshakeh returned, and found the king of Assyria warring against Libnah, for he heard that he had departed from Lachish.
And the king heard concerning Tirhakah king of Ethiopia, “He has come out to make war with you.” So when he heard  he sent messengers to Hezekiah, saying,
“Thus you shall speak to Hezekiah king of Judah, saying: ‘Do not let your God in whom you trust deceive you, saying, “Jerusalem shall not be given into the hand of the king of Assyria.”
Look! You have heard what the kings of Assyria have done to all lands by utterly destroying them; and shall you be delivered?
Have the gods of the nations delivered those whom my fathers have destroyed, Gozan and Haran and Rezeph, and the people of Eden who  in Telassar?
Where  the king of Hamath, the king of Arpad, and the king of the city of Sepharvaim, Hena, and Ivah?’ ”
And Hezekiah received the letter from the hand of the messengers, and read it; and Hezekiah went up to the house of the , and spread it before the .

Incline Your ear, O , and hear; open Your eyes, O , and see; and hear all the words of Sennacherib, which he has sent to reproach the living God.
Truly, , the kings of Assyria have laid waste all the nations and their lands,
and have cast their gods into the fire; for they  not gods, but the work of men’s hands—wood and stone. Therefore they destroyed them.
Now therefore, O  our God, save us from his hand, that all the kingdoms of the earth may know that You  the , You alone.”

Sennacherib’s Defeat and Death(V)
Then the angel of the  went out, and killed in the camp of the Assyrians one hundred and eighty-five thousand; and when  arose early in the morning, there were the corpses—all dead.
So Sennacherib king of Assyria departed and went away, returned  and remained at Nineveh.

Now it came to pass, as he was worshiping in the house of Nisroch his god, that his sons Adrammelech and Sharezer struck him down with the sword; and they escaped into the land of Ararat. Then Esarhaddon his son reigned in his place.
